TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit XmlEventArgs extends System.EventArgs
Public MustInherit Class XmlEventArgs Inherits EventArgs
public ref class XmlEventArgs abstract : EventArgs

remarks.para: The XmlEventArgs object is passed to the event handler for the Changed event, which occurs after changes to the form's underlying XML document have been accepted and the event has occurred. The XmlEventArgs object provides a number of properties that can be used within the event handler to programmatically interact with the data that is being changed in the form's underlying XML document and to get information about the node that is being changed.

The XmlEventArgs object provides the property which gets a reference to an XPathNavigator object that that is positioned at the node that is being changed, and can be used to work with this node and other data in a form's underlying XML document.
The and classes for the corresponding events are derived from the XmlEventArgs class and expose the same set of properties.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Match As XPathExpression
public: abstract property System::Xml::XPath::XPathExpression ^ Match { System::Xml::XPath::XPathExpression ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets an object which contains an XPath expression that returns the node that is currently being changed.
Docs.value: A object that returns the node that is currently being changed in the form's underlying XML document.

remarks.para: The XPathExpression object returned by Match property contains a compiled XPath expression that points to a node in the form's underlying XML document. This is the node that raised the event to which the event handler is responding.
This member can be accessed without restrictions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property NewValue As String
public: abstract property System::String ^ NewValue { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the new value for the node being changed.
Docs.value: The value that will replace the existing value.

remarks.para: The NewValue property contains the value of the node that will replace the existing value. To get the original value of the node, use the property.
This member can be accessed without restrictions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property OldParent As XPathNavigator
public: abstract property System::Xml::XPath::XPathNavigator ^ OldParent { System::Xml::XPath::XPathNavigator ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets an object pointing to the node which is the parent of the node being deleted.
Docs.value: An object for the parent of the deleted node.

remarks.para: The value of the OldParent property is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) unless the change that is occurring is a delete operation. When a delete operation was performed, the property will return XmlOperation.Delete.
This member can be accessed without restrictions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property OldValue As String
public: abstract property System::String ^ OldValue { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the original value of the node that is being changed.
Docs.value: The original value of the node that is being changed.

remarks.para: The OldValue property returns the original value of the node that will be replaced with a new value or deleted. To get the new value of the node, use the property.
This member can be accessed without restrictions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Operation As XmlOperation
public: abstract property Microsoft::Office::InfoPath::XmlOperation Operation { Microsoft::Office::InfoPath::XmlOperation get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets an enumeration that indicates the type of operation that occurred when the node was changed.
Docs.value: An enumeration for the operation that has occurred.

remarks.para: The XmlOperation enumeration values that the Operation property returns are: XmlOperation.Insert, XmlOperation.ValueChange, and XmlOperation.Delete. Which operations can occur depends on the structure of the control to which the handler for the event is bound. For example, for a Text Box control, the node that the control is bound to can never be inserted or deleted, so only the XmlOperation.ValueChange operation can occur. Whereas, for a repeating control, such as a Repeating Table control, in addition to XmlOperation.ValueChange operations that can occur in the fields in the table's columns, entire groups (rows) can be inserted and deleted, which cause the Operation property to return the corresponding XmlOperation.Insert and XmlOperation.Delete enumeration values.
This member can be accessed without restrictions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Site As XPathNavigator
public: abstract property System::Xml::XPath::XPathNavigator ^ Site { System::Xml::XPath::XPathNavigator ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets an object pointing at the node that is being changed.
Docs.value: An object pointing to the changed node.

remarks.para: After you set a reference to the XPathNavigator object that the Site property returns, you can use any of the properties and methods that are supported by the XPathNavigator class to work with the data.
This member can be accessed without restrictions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property UndoRedo As Boolean
public: abstract property bool UndoRedo { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the node being changed is part of an undo or redo operation.
Docs.value: true if the node being changed is part of an undo or redo operation; otherwise false.

remarks.para: When an undo or a redo operation takes place, the form's underlying XML document is placed in a read-only state and cannot be modified. If this occurs during a event, the UndoRedo property can be used to bypass the data validation logic contained in the handler for the event.
This member can be accessed without restrictions.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.
